cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with text classification, which is a common topic in the natural language processing (NLP) subfield of computer science. Specifically, it focuses on improving the bag-of-words model, which is a standard representation of text used in many NLP applications. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the use of Word Vector models, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning applications. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper's focus on improving classification accuracy suggests that it could also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with techniques for retrieving relevant information from large collections of data. 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of Word Vector models for image classification, which suggests that it could also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision), which deals with techniques for analyzing and understanding visual data.
